column4: whats the diff between ubuntu and kubuntu ? just that kubuntu uses kde ?
so you cant kde kde in ubuntu ?
have been for long time just want to know
Whenever a release is made, a new testing is forked off. there is no perprtual unstable.
So it conveniently fits onto a single CD iso. Just a matter of naming.
Anyway, with ubuntu, if you run `stable', you end up with pretty new packages and a certain amount of stability. It doesn't break in some of the major ways sid does sometimes.
Releases are scheduled to be a month and a bit after Gnome releases, so you end up always using the latest stable gnome.
Well, for example the sid pam brokenness from 2005 - you won't get that :-)
The `alternative' use d-i, not that livecd monstrosity.
No, as it's not stable yet.
